19  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc;
20  
21  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
22  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
23  import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
24  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.HBaseSaslRpcClient;
25  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.HBaseSaslRpcServer.AuthMethod;
26  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.KerberosInfo;
27  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.TokenInfo;
28  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.User;
29  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.AuthenticationTokenIdentifier;
30  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.token.AuthenticationTokenSelector;
31  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.PoolMap;
32  import org.apache.hadoop.io.*;
33  import org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException;
34  import org.apache.hadoop.net.NetUtils;
35  import org.apache.hadoop.security.SecurityUtil;
36  import org.apache.hadoop.security.UserGroupInformation;
37  import org.apache.hadoop.security.token.Token;
38  import org.apache.hadoop.security.token.TokenIdentifier;
39  import org.apache.hadoop.security.token.TokenSelector;
40  import org.apache.hadoop.util.ReflectionUtils;

42  import javax.net.SocketFactory;
43  import javax.security.sasl.SaslException;
44  import java.io.*;
45  import java.net.*;
46  import java.security.PrivilegedExceptionAction;
47  import java.util.HashMap;
48  import java.util.Hashtable;
49  import java.util.Iterator;
50  import java.util.Map;
51  import java.util.Map.Entry;
52  import java.util.Random;
53  import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap;
54  import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
55  import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;

57  /**
58   * A client for an IPC service, which support SASL authentication of connections
59   * using either GSSAPI for Kerberos authentication or DIGEST-MD5 for
60   * authentication using signed tokens.
61   *
62   * <p>
63   * This is a copy of org.apache.hadoop.ipc.Client from secure Hadoop,
64   * reworked to remove code duplicated with
65   * {@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseClient}.  This is part of the loadable
66   * {@link SecureRpcEngine}, and only functions in connection with a
67   * {@link SecureServer} instance.
68   * </p>
69   */
70  public class SecureClient extends HBaseClient {
71  
72    private static final Log LOG =
73      LogFactory.getLog("org.apache.hadoop.ipc.SecureClient");
74  
75    protected static Map<String,TokenSelector<? extends TokenIdentifier>> tokenHandlers =
76        new HashMap<String,TokenSelector<? extends TokenIdentifier>>();
77    static {
78      tokenHandlers.put(AuthenticationTokenIdentifier.AUTH_TOKEN_TYPE.toString(),
79          new AuthenticationTokenSelector());
80    }
81  
82    /** Thread that reads responses and notifies callers.  Each connection owns a
83     * socket connected to a remote address.  Calls are multiplexed through this
84     * socket: responses may be delivered out of order. */
85    protected class SecureConnection extends Connection {
86      private InetSocketAddress server;             // server ip:port
87      private String serverPrincipal;  // server's krb5 principal name
88      private SecureConnectionHeader header;              // connection header
89      private AuthMethod authMethod; // authentication method
90      private boolean useSasl;
91      private Token<? extends TokenIdentifier> token;
92      private HBaseSaslRpcClient saslRpcClient;
93      private int reloginMaxBackoff; // max pause before relogin on sasl failure
94  
95      public SecureConnection(ConnectionId remoteId) throws IOException {
96        super(remoteId);
97        this.server = remoteId.getAddress();
98  
99        User ticket = remoteId.getTicket();
100       Class<?> protocol = remoteId.getProtocol();
101       this.useSasl = User.isHBaseSecurityEnabled(conf);
102       if (useSasl && protocol != null) {
103         TokenInfo tokenInfo = protocol.getAnnotation(TokenInfo.class);
104         if (tokenInfo != null) {
105           TokenSelector<? extends TokenIdentifier> tokenSelector =
106               tokenHandlers.get(tokenInfo.value());
107           if (tokenSelector != null) {
108             token = tokenSelector.selectToken(new Text(clusterId),
109                 ticket.getUGI().getTokens());
110           } else if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
111             LOG.debug("No token selector found for type "+tokenInfo.value());
112           }
113         }
114         KerberosInfo krbInfo = protocol.getAnnotation(KerberosInfo.class);
115         if (krbInfo != null) {
116           String serverKey = krbInfo.serverPrincipal();
117           if (serverKey == null) {
118             throw new IOException(
119                 "Can't obtain server Kerberos config key from KerberosInfo");
120           }
121           serverPrincipal = SecurityUtil.getServerPrincipal(
122               conf.get(serverKey), server.getAddress().getCanonicalHostName().toLowerCase());
123           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
124             LOG.debug("RPC Server Kerberos principal name for protocol="
125                 + protocol.getCanonicalName() + " is " + serverPrincipal);
126           }
127         }
128       }
129 
130       if (!useSasl) {
131         authMethod = AuthMethod.SIMPLE;
132       } else if (token != null) {
133         authMethod = AuthMethod.DIGEST;
134       } else {
135         authMethod = AuthMethod.KERBEROS;
136       }
137 
138       header = new SecureConnectionHeader(
139           protocol == null ? null : protocol.getName(), ticket, authMethod);
140 
141       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
142         LOG.debug("Use " + authMethod + " authentication for protocol "
143             + protocol.getSimpleName());
144 
145       reloginMaxBackoff = conf.getInt("hbase.security.relogin.maxbackoff", 5000);
146     }
147 
148     private synchronized void disposeSasl() {
149       if (saslRpcClient != null) {
150         try {
151           saslRpcClient.dispose();
152           saslRpcClient = null;
153         } catch (IOException ioe) {
154           LOG.info("Error disposing of SASL client", ioe);
155         }
156       }
157     }
158 
159     private synchronized boolean shouldAuthenticateOverKrb() throws IOException {
160       UserGroupInformation loginUser = UserGroupInformation.getLoginUser();
161       UserGroupInformation currentUser =
162         UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser();
163       UserGroupInformation realUser = currentUser.getRealUser();
164       return authMethod == AuthMethod.KERBEROS &&
165           loginUser != null &&
166           //Make sure user logged in using Kerberos either keytab or TGT
167           loginUser.hasKerberosCredentials() &&
168           // relogin only in case it is the login user (e.g. JT)
169           // or superuser (like oozie).
170           (loginUser.equals(currentUser) || loginUser.equals(realUser));
171     }
172 
173     private synchronized boolean setupSaslConnection(final InputStream in2,
174         final OutputStream out2)
175         throws IOException {
176       saslRpcClient = new HBaseSaslRpcClient(authMethod, token, serverPrincipal);
177       return saslRpcClient.saslConnect(in2, out2);
178     }
179 
180     /**
181      * If multiple clients with the same principal try to connect
182      * to the same server at the same time, the server assumes a
183      * replay attack is in progress. This is a feature of kerberos.
184      * In order to work around this, what is done is that the client
185      * backs off randomly and tries to initiate the connection
186      * again.
187      * The other problem is to do with ticket expiry. To handle that,
188      * a relogin is attempted.
189      * <p>
190      * The retry logic is governed by the {@link #shouldAuthenticateOverKrb}
191      * method. In case when the user doesn't have valid credentials, we don't
192      * need to retry (from cache or ticket). In such cases, it is prudent to
193      * throw a runtime exception when we receive a SaslException from the
194      * underlying authentication implementation, so there is no retry from 
195      * other high level (for eg, HCM or HBaseAdmin).
196      * </p>
197      */
198     private synchronized void handleSaslConnectionFailure(
199         final int currRetries,
200         final int maxRetries, final Exception ex, final Random rand,
201         final User user)
202     throws IOException, InterruptedException{
203       user.runAs(new PrivilegedExceptionAction<Object>() {
204         public Object run() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
205           closeConnection();
206           if (shouldAuthenticateOverKrb()) {
207             if (currRetries < maxRetries) {
208               LOG.debug("Exception encountered while connecting to " +
209                   "the server : " + ex);
210               //try re-login
211               if (UserGroupInformation.isLoginKeytabBased()) {
212                 UserGroupInformation.getLoginUser().reloginFromKeytab();
213               } else {
214                 UserGroupInformation.getLoginUser().reloginFromTicketCache();
215               }
216               disposeSasl();
217               //have granularity of milliseconds
218               //we are sleeping with the Connection lock held but since this
219               //connection instance is being used for connecting to the server
220               //in question, it is okay
221               Thread.sleep((rand.nextInt(reloginMaxBackoff) + 1));
222               return null;
223             } else {
224               String msg = "Couldn't setup connection for " +
225               UserGroupInformation.getLoginUser().getUserName() +
226               " to " + serverPrincipal;
227               LOG.warn(msg);
228               throw (IOException) new IOException(msg).initCause(ex);
229             }
230           } else {
231             LOG.warn("Exception encountered while connecting to " +
232                 "the server : " + ex);
233           }
234           if (ex instanceof RemoteException) {
235             throw (RemoteException)ex;
236           }
237           if (ex instanceof SaslException) {
238             String msg = "SASL authentication failed." +
239               " The most likely cause is missing or invalid credentials." +
240               " Consider 'kinit'.";
241             LOG.fatal(msg, ex);
242             throw new RuntimeException(msg, ex);
243           }
244           throw new IOException(ex);
245         }
246       });
247     }
248 
249     @Override
250     protected synchronized void setupIOstreams()
251         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
252       if (socket != null || shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
253         return;
254       }
255 
256       try {
257         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
258           LOG.debug("Connecting to "+server);
259         }
260         short numRetries = 0;
261         final short MAX_RETRIES = 5;
262         Random rand = null;
263         while (true) {
264           setupConnection();
265           InputStream inStream = NetUtils.getInputStream(socket);
266           OutputStream outStream = NetUtils.getOutputStream(socket);
267           writeRpcHeader(outStream);
268           if (useSasl) {
269             final InputStream in2 = inStream;
270             final OutputStream out2 = outStream;
271             User ticket = remoteId.getTicket();
272             if (authMethod == AuthMethod.KERBEROS) {
273               UserGroupInformation ugi = ticket.getUGI();
274               if (ugi != null && ugi.getRealUser() != null) {
275                 ticket = User.create(ugi.getRealUser());
276               }
277             }
278             boolean continueSasl = false;
279             try {
280               continueSasl =
281                 ticket.runAs(new PrivilegedExceptionAction<Boolean>() {
282                   @Override
283                   public Boolean run() throws IOException {
284                     return setupSaslConnection(in2, out2);
285                   }
286                 });
287             } catch (Exception ex) {
288               if (rand == null) {
289                 rand = new Random();
290               }
291               handleSaslConnectionFailure(numRetries++, MAX_RETRIES, ex, rand,
292                    ticket);
293               continue;
294             }
295             if (continueSasl) {
296               // Sasl connect is successful. Let's set up Sasl i/o streams.
297               inStream = saslRpcClient.getInputStream(inStream);
298               outStream = saslRpcClient.getOutputStream(outStream);
299             } else {
300               // fall back to simple auth because server told us so.
301               authMethod = AuthMethod.SIMPLE;
302               header = new SecureConnectionHeader(header.getProtocol(),
303                   header.getUser(), authMethod);
304               useSasl = false;
305             }
306           }
307           this.in = new DataInputStream(new BufferedInputStream
308               (new PingInputStream(inStream)));
309           this.out = new DataOutputStream
310           (new BufferedOutputStream(outStream));
311           writeHeader();
312 
313           // update last activity time
314           touch();
315 
316           // start the receiver thread after the socket connection has been set up
317           start();
318           return;
319         }
320       } catch (IOException e) {
321         markClosed(e);
322         close();
323 
324         throw e;
325       }
326     }
327 
328     /* Write the RPC header */
329     private void writeRpcHeader(OutputStream outStream) throws IOException {
330       DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(new BufferedOutputStream(outStream));
331       // Write out the header, version and authentication method
332       out.write(SecureServer.HEADER.array());
333       out.write(SecureServer.CURRENT_VERSION);
334       authMethod.write(out);
335       out.flush();
336     }
337 
338     /**
339      * Write the protocol header for each connection
340      * Out is not synchronized because only the first thread does this.
341      */
342     private void writeHeader() throws IOException {
343       // Write out the ConnectionHeader
344       DataOutputBuffer buf = new DataOutputBuffer();
345       header.write(buf);
346 
347       // Write out the payload length
348       int bufLen = buf.getLength();
349       out.writeInt(bufLen);
350       out.write(buf.getData(), 0, bufLen);
351     }
352 
353     @Override
354     protected void receiveResponse() {
355       if (shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
356         return;
357       }
358       touch();
359 
360       try {
361         int id = in.readInt();                    // try to read an id
362 
363         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
364           LOG.debug(getName() + " got value #" + id);
365 
366         Call call = calls.remove(id);
367 
368         int state = in.readInt();     // read call status
369         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
370           LOG.debug("call #"+id+" state is " + state);
371         }
372         if (state == Status.SUCCESS.state) {
373           Writable value = ReflectionUtils.newInstance(valueClass, conf);
374           value.readFields(in);                 // read value
375           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
376             LOG.debug("call #"+id+", response is:\n"+value.toString());
377           }
378           // it's possible that this call may have been cleaned up due to a RPC
379           // timeout, so check if it still exists before setting the value.
380           if (call != null) {
381             call.setValue(value);
382           }
383         } else if (state == Status.ERROR.state) {
384           if (call != null) {
385             call.setException(new RemoteException(WritableUtils.readString(in), WritableUtils
386                 .readString(in)));
387           }
388         } else if (state == Status.FATAL.state) {
389           // Close the connection
390           markClosed(new RemoteException(WritableUtils.readString(in),
391                                          WritableUtils.readString(in)));
392         }
393       } catch (IOException e) {
394         if (e instanceof SocketTimeoutException && remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
395           // Clean up open calls but don't treat this as a fatal condition,
396           // since we expect certain responses to not make it by the specified
397           // {@link ConnectionId#rpcTimeout}.
398           closeException = e;
399         } else {
400           // Since the server did not respond within the default ping interval
401           // time, treat this as a fatal condition and close this connection
402           markClosed(e);
403         }
404       } finally {
405         if (remoteId.rpcTimeout > 0) {
406           cleanupCalls(remoteId.rpcTimeout);
407         }
408       }
409     }
410 
411     /** Close the connection. */
412     protected synchronized void close() {
413       if (!shouldCloseConnection.get()) {
414         LOG.error("The connection is not in the closed state");
415         return;
416       }
417 
418       // release the resources
419       // first thing to do;take the connection out of the connection list
420       synchronized (connections) {
421         connections.remove(remoteId, this);
422       }
423 
424       // close the streams and therefore the socket
425       IOUtils.closeStream(out);
426       IOUtils.closeStream(in);
427       disposeSasl();
428 
429       // clean up all calls
430       if (closeException == null) {
431         if (!calls.isEmpty()) {
432           LOG.warn(
433               "A connection is closed for no cause and calls are not empty");
434 
435           // clean up calls anyway
436           closeException = new IOException("Unexpected closed connection");
437           cleanupCalls();
438         }
439       } else {
440         // log the info
441         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
442           LOG.debug("closing ipc connection to " + server + ": " +
443               closeException.getMessage(),closeException);
444         }
445 
446         // cleanup calls
447         cleanupCalls();
448       }
449       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
450         LOG.debug(getName() + ": closed");
451     }
452   }
453 
454   /**
455    * Construct an IPC client whose values are of the given {@link org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable}
456    * class.
457    * @param valueClass value class
458    * @param conf configuration
459    * @param factory socket factory
460    */
461   public SecureClient(Class<? extends Writable> valueClass, Configuration conf,
462       SocketFactory factory) {
463     super(valueClass, conf, factory);
464   }
465 
466   /**
467    * Construct an IPC client with the default SocketFactory
468    * @param valueClass value class
469    * @param conf configuration
470    */
471   public SecureClient(Class<? extends Writable> valueClass, Configuration conf) {
472     this(valueClass, conf, NetUtils.getDefaultSocketFactory(conf));
473   }
474 
475   /**
476    * Creates a SecureConnection. Can be overridden by a subclass for testing.
477    * @param remoteId - the ConnectionId to use for the connection creation.
478    */
479   @Override
480   protected SecureConnection createConnection(ConnectionId remoteId) throws IOException {
481     return new SecureConnection(remoteId);
482   }
483 }
